intro: Pedicularis hinksii, commonly known as the Hinks' lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking red or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in alpine or subalpine habitats, often in rocky or open areas. Its unique appearance and habitat make it a notable species in botanical studies and ecological research.
